turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I can help with that! For strategy games, some popular choices include real-time strategy (RTS), turn-based strategy (TBS), and grand strategy games. Do any of those subgenres particularly interest you, or are you looking for something more specific?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, I like turn-based strategy games, like Civilization, but I also enjoy a good story. Are there any turn-based strategy games with a really compelling narrative that you'd recommend? I've played a lot of the mainstream ones, so something a bit more obscure would be great.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Let me see... A turn-based strategy game with a strong narrative, and something not super mainstream. How about 'The Banner Saga' trilogy? It's a Viking-themed strategy RPG with beautiful hand-drawn animation and a deeply branching story focused on tough choices. Another option could be 'Age of Wonders: Planetfall', which combines 4X strategy with tactical combat and a sci-fi setting featuring various factions with unique storylines. Does either of those sound interesting?

turns.speaker: user
